but I'm still not sure what you want to do as terry says you don't want to share wlan0 with eth0 and your switch box
ok then just give your eth0 an address sudo ifconfig eth0 192.168.4.2 and share that
and again look at what's needed here https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Internet/ConnectionSharing
you need to make sure that the address won't conflict
since your wlan0 address must come from a dhcp server you must use that and setup an address on eth0 that won't conflict
this is your wlan0 address 192.168.1.33  so your eth0 can be 192.168.2.33  or anything other than 192.168.1.x
